org.jooby

Interface Err.Handler

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Err.Default
    Enclosing class:
    Err

    public static interface Err.Handler
    Route error handler, it creates a default err model and default view name. The default err handler does content negotation on error, see Err.Default.
    Since:
    0.1.0
    Author:
    edgar

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      default Map<String,Object> err(Request req, Response rsp, Exception ex)
      Build a err model from exception.
      default String errPage(Request req, Response rsp, Exception ex)
      Convert current err to a view location, defaults is: /err.
      void handle(Request req, Response rsp, Exception ex)
      Handle a route exception by probably logging the error and sending a err response to the client.

    • Method Detail

      • err

        default Map<String,Object> err(Request req,
                               Response rsp,
                               Exception ex)
        Build a err model from exception. The model it's map with the following attributes: 
           message: String
   stacktrace: String[]
   status: int
   reason: String
   referer: String

        NOTE: Response.status() it was set by default to status code > 400. This is the default behavior you can use the generated status code and/or override it.

        Parameters:
        req - A HTTP Request.
        rsp - A HTTP Response with a default err status code (> 400).
        ex - Current exception object.
        Returns:
        A err model.

      • errPage

        default String errPage(Request req,
                       Response rsp,
                       Exception ex)
        Convert current err to a view location, defaults is: /err.
        Parameters:
        req - HTTP request.
        rsp - HTTP Response.
        ex - Error found.
        Returns:
        An err page to be render by a template processor.

      • handle

        void handle(Request req,
            Response rsp,
            Exception ex)
     throws Exception
        Handle a route exception by probably logging the error and sending a err response to the client.
        Parameters:
        req - HTTP request.
        rsp - HTTP response.
        ex - Error found.
        Throws:
        Exception - If something goes wrong.
